column4: Hi all, I have problem installing or removing any packages on my ubuntu-feisty. It complained something with the cluster management system. here is the error message: invoke-rc.d: initscript clvm, action "start" failed.
dpkg: error while cleaning up:
subprocess post-installation script returned error exit status 3
Removing ubuntu-desktop ...
Errors were encountered while processing:
clvm
E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (1)
anybody had this issue before?
#ubuntu+1 or Feisty support, thanks
yes
No, that's a security risk
Why? I want to know what passwords my user tried to login with(me being an admin)
because other users would be the same, (you'd be able to see their failed password attempts) and that would give you hints as to their password (here, or otherwise).
Exactly. So could it be possible to modify the sshd logging system to give passwords too?
I would hope not.  Since that's really a bad idea.  What do you hope to gain from doing so?
Well, for the past 2 days...some fuckers try to connect to my box with users like admin, root and fluffy(wtf?). they connect to me from firewalls and switches
all the ip's come from italy
knowing the passwords they're trying won't really help.  You should look into denyhosts
Yes. And leave them a nice little message. GET THE F*** OUT
that is also legal. thanks
DenyHosts is in the repositories too, if you didn't notice.
